showScoreExcerpt:
the show retains all 13 of Sherman Edwards’ original, often bright and tuneful songs from the 1969 production, and also most of the sometimes goofy humor. At the same time, it makes some half dozen changes that sometimes provide a fresh perspective; most often offer a new emphasis on what’s always been the strongest aspects of the musical; and only occasionally go too far… the most obvious and consequential change in the revival: The cast is racially diverse, and all of them identify as either female or transgender or nonbinary.
